parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED
Expected IDs from TOC: class_id=0x01, message_id=0x3c

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
3. Verify field sizes match offset differences.

=== DATA TYPES ===

Scalar types (use EXACTLY these values):
- U1, U2, U4, U8 = Unsigned integers (1/2/4/8 bytes)
- I1, I2, I4, I8 = Signed integers - NOTE: "I" is capital letter i, NOT digit 1
- X1, X2, X4, X8 = Bitfields (use for flags, mask, status fields)
- R4, R8 = Floating point (4/8 bytes)
- CH = ASCII character (1 byte)

Array types: Use object format {"array_of": "U1", "count": N}
- Check Type column for "[N]" or "x N" notation
- Verify array size matches offset gap to next field

=== CHARACTER RECOGNITION WARNINGS ===

The PDF uses fonts where these characters look similar:
- "I" (letter i) vs "1" (digit one): Data types are I1, I2, I4 (not 11, 12, 14)
- "O" (letter o) vs "0" (digit zero): Message names like UBX-ODO use letter "O"

=== FIELD EXTRACTION ===

For each field extract:
- name: Exact field name from PDF (preserve camelCase)
- byte_offset: Integer from "Offset" column (0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX type or array object
- description: Field description text
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- scale: If scaling factor shown, include {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7}
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- bitfield: For X-type fields with bit definitions, extract structure

=== ARRAY DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Common extraction error: missing arrays. Check carefully:
- Type column shows: "U1[6]", "U1 x 6", "CH[30]" = array
- Offset gaps reveal arrays: offset 4 to 8 with U1 = 4-byte array
- Reserved fields often span multiple bytes

=== BITFIELD DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Use X1/X2/X4 (NOT U1/U2/U4) when:
- Field named "flags", "mask", "status", "cfg", "supported", "enabled"
- Description mentions "bitfield" or lists bit meanings
- Sub-table shows bit positions

Extract bitfield structure for ALL X-type fields:
{"bits": [{"name": "bitName", "bit_start": 0, "bit_end": 0, "description": "..."}]}

=== PAYLOAD LENGTH ===

- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12", "min": 8}}

=== REPEATED GROUPS (CRITICAL) ===

Many UBX messages contain repeated blocks of fields. Look for:
- "N x ..." or "numXxx x ..." patterns in the payload table
- Fields that repeat based on a count field (e.g., numSvs, numCh)
- Variable-length payloads with repeating structures

Extract repeated groups as:
{"repeated_groups": [{
  "name": "groupName",
  "repetition_type": "count_field",
  "count_field": "numSvs",
  "group_size_bytes": 12,
  "base_offset": 8,
  "fields": [...]
}]}

Common patterns:
- INF messages: Have a "str" repeated group for variable-length text
- NAV-SAT, NAV-ORB: Have satellite blocks repeated per numSvs
- MON-RXBUF: Has pending[] arrays per port

=== MESSAGE TYPE ===

Determine from context:
- "periodic" or "periodic_polled": Output messages sent automatically or on poll
- "input": Messages sent TO the receiver
- "output": Messages sent FROM the receiver  
- "command": One-shot commands
- "get"/"set"/"get_set": Configuration messages
- "poll_request": Poll request (usually empty payload)

=== SPECIAL MESSAGE TYPES ===

**UBX-INF-* (INF-DEBUG, INF-ERROR, INF-NOTICE, INF-WARNING, INF-TEST):**
- These contain a variable-length ASCII string payload
- Extract a single field named "str" with data_type {"array_of": "CH", "count": "variable"}
- Use repeated_groups with repetition_type "fill_remaining" for the string
- Do NOT return empty fields array

**UBX-MGA-* (Multiple GNSS Assistance):**
- Often have MULTIPLE SUB-TYPES on same pages (EPH, ALM, IONO, etc.)
- Each sub-type has different "type" field value and different payload
- Extract ONLY the sub-type matching the message name
- If name includes sub-type (e.g., "UBX-MGA-GPS-EPH"), extract only that

**UBX-LOG-FINDTIME:**
- Has TWO structures: INPUT (request) and OUTPUT (response)
- INPUT: version, type, year, month, day, hour, minute, second, reserved
- OUTPUT: version, type, reserved, entryNumber
- Extract based on message name suffix (-INPUT or -OUTPUT)

**UBX-RXM-RLM:**
- Has SHORT (16 bytes, type=0x01) and LONG (28 bytes, type=0x02) variants
- Extract based on message name suffix (-SHORT or -LONG)

**UBX-RXM-PMREQ:**
- V0 (8 bytes): duration, flags - NO version field
- V1 (16 bytes): version, reserved0[3], duration, flags, wakeupSources
- Extract based on suffix (-V0 or -V1)

=== QUALITY CHECKS ===

Before returning, verify:
- Byte offsets are sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps (offset 4 to 8 = 4 bytes)
- Total field sizes match payload length
- All fields from the payload table are included
If any of these appear to fail, you should review your initial extraction and re-extract the message.


=== VARIANT MESSAGE: UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED ===
This message has TWO structures:
- V0 (40 bytes): version=0x00, older format, flags at offset 36
- V1 (64 bytes): version=0x01, newer format with relPosLength/Heading, flags at offset 60
Check payload length: 40 bytes = V0, 64 bytes = V1.


=== MESSAGE NAME FORMAT (CRITICAL) ===

The "name" field MUST be EXACTLY "UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED" with NO modifications:
- Do NOT add descriptions like "(Poll request)" or "(Version 0)"
- Do NOT add suffixes like "Request" or "Poll"
- Do NOT include any parenthetical text
- Use ONLY the canonical message name: "UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED"

=== OUTPUT FORMAT ===

Return a JSON object with this structure:
{
  "name": "UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED",
  "class_id": "0xNN",
  "message_id": "0xNN",
  "description": "Short description",
  "message_type": "output",
  "payload": {
    "length": {"fixed": N} or {"variable": {...}},
    "fields": [
      {
        "name": "fieldName",
        "byte_offset": 0,
        "data_type": "U4",
        "description": "...",
        "unit": "ms",
        "scale": {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7},
        "bitfield": {"bits": [...]}
      }
    ],
    "repeated_groups": [...]
  }
}

Extract the message completely and accurately.

extracted_structure.name: UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED
extracted_structure.description: Relative positioning information in NED frame

fields.name: version
fields.description: Message version (0x01 for this version)

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: refStationId
fields.description: Reference station ID. Must be in the range 0..4095.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: relPosN
fields.description: North component of relative position vector

fields.name: relPosE
fields.description: East component of relative position vector

fields.name: relPosD
fields.description: Down component of relative position vector

fields.name: relPosLength
fields.description: Length of the relative position vector

fields.name: relPosHeading
fields.description: Heading of the relative position vector

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: relPosHPN
fields.description: High-precision North component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full North component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosN + (relPosHPN * 1e-2)

fields.name: relPosHPE
fields.description: High-precision East component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full East component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosE + (relPosHPE * 1e-2)

fields.name: relPosHPD
fields.description: High-precision Down component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full Down component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosD + (relPosHPD * 1e-2)

fields.name: relPosHPLength
fields.description: High-precision component of the length of the relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full length of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosLength + (relPosHPLength * 1e-2)

fields.name: accN
fields.description: Accuracy of relative position North component

fields.name: accE
fields.description: Accuracy of relative position East component

fields.name: accD
fields.description: Accuracy of relative position Down component

fields.name: accLength
fields.description: Accuracy of length of the relative position vector

fields.name: accHeading
fields.description: Accuracy of heading of the relative position vector

fields.name: reserved2
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags

bits.name: gnssFixOK
bits.description: A valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

bits.name: relPosValid
bits.description: 1 if relative position components and accuracies are valid and, in moving base mode only, if baseline is valid

bits.name: carrSoln
bits.description: Carrier phase range solution status: 0 = no carrier phase range solution, 1 = carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities, 2 = carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities

bits.name: isMoving
bits.description: 1 if the receiver is operating in moving base mode

bits.name: refPosMiss
bits.description: 1 if extrapolated reference position was used to compute moving base solution this epoch.

bits.name: refObsMiss
bits.description: 1 if extrapolated reference observations were used to compute moving base solution this epoch.

bits.name: relPosNormalized
bits.description: 1 if the components of the relative position vector (including the high-precision parts) are normalized
